column7: I have always loved travelling by Air India and their services are always impeccable. I love their food (especially the Shahi Paneer) and the excellent in-flight services. They also value members a lot and don't be surprised when you get free upgrades to Business Class!

column1: Sunita Saldanha wrote a review Jun 2016
column7:
Not the fanciest of flights but I noticed that the business class has a better hostess than the economy.

Also 5 stars for the food that was served.

column1: Vikram D wrote a review Jun 2016
column7:
The only thing good on this flight is that it was a Dreamliner so the seats were comfortable with extra legroom. The following things did not help create a pleasant experience:
1) Old and grumpy in flight attendants
2) Lot of the in flight entertainment screens not working (including mine)
3) Average selection and quality of food

Poor overall condition of the aircraft. Definitely not an airline to fly with unless you have not other option!!

column1: Niladri C wrote a review Jun 2016
column6: Travel only if you have no other option
column7: The worst experience in life. The worst air hostesses in the whole entire world. Broken seats, Stinky toilets, for food also you need to go and ask them. My suggestion is fly only if you have no other option. Specially attitude of the air hostesses over the whole airlines is very bad across all the routes. Think 100 times before you travel.
the fare was not so cheap but the service was too good..amazing experience ...want to go again and again in this flight..

We had a good flying experience with Air India. Fortunately we got the seats we wanted and hence were comfortable for 9 hours. Food which was served was good, fresh and warm. The crew was courteous and humble. The captain personally came and greeted us. Always recommend flying by Air India

The food was good. AirIndia is the only flight where you won't miss the Indian food. :)

Movie collection and display screen need improvement. Screen touch is not good. Also, staff needs to be more energetic. They look more tired than the traveller itself.

Pleasantly surprised with the new Dreamliner and the staff. The plane was surprisingly very clean with humidifiers. The hostess was a young girl willing to put the extra effort to please. The seats were comfortable. All said worth it.

column6: If you like delays or unprofessional service, Fly Air India
column7: I have not experienced a worse service while flying with any other airline. The reservation process is complicated... they charge you what they want... not necessarily the amount shown on the page.. do not dare to ask for some water... i have not had one flight on-time with this Airline... it is a shame for the Star Alliance to have them on board !

column1: Habib Mohammed Hadi wrote a review Jun 2016
column7: Every Indian I know complains about Air India but for me it is the best airlines. I always first or business class with them and if any time if I don't get first or business class if they are full then I take economy but at the time of check-in I get upgraded to business class atleast.

column6: My recent travel to Tirupati (to and fro)
column7:
Had only one direct flight to Tirupati at layover at Hyderabad. It is long journey of 4 hours plus. The crew was really good and helpful. We had paid extra money for the front seats as we are travelling with my son, who is just 10 months.Even at the checkin counter, the staff were really friendly and good.
The food quality was good.

column1: Leena G wrote a review Jun 2016
column7: Smooth flight Great entertainment in flight ,good service at the check in counter. Food on board was good. The airline could do better with a younger helpful ,smiling and welcoming staff.

its pleasure flying with air india if it is on time , and this time it wa spot on and infact arrived kolkata 15 minutes before..the food they serve is best indian food ..no other airlines give such delicious food.Moreover they had entertainment during flight from delhi to kolkata and that was quiet a surprise

column6: Good Travel Hope they were more organised
column7: I was travelling from Ahmedabad to Raipur vis Mumbai. The Ahmedabad Mumbai was in Boeing Dream-liner. I was travelling first time in dreamliner. The flying experience was excellent. For once you really get to feel the difference between LCC and full cost carrier. There were some hassles at Ahmedabad airport but all in all excellent experience. Wish the flight had been longer.

AI 476 Take off from Jodhpur to Delhi.
Good service in flight by airhost.
Founded in 1932 by J. R. D. Tata and later renamed as Tata Airlines, he flew its first single-engine De Havilland Puss Moth, carrying air mail from Karachi to Bombay and later continuing to Madras (currently Chennai). After World War II, it became a public limited company and was renamed to Air India. On 21 February 1960, it included its first Boeing 707–420 named Gauri Shankar and became the first Asian airline to induct a jet aircraft in its fleet. In 2000–01, attempts were made to privatize Air India and from 2006 onwards, it suffered losses after its merger with Indian.

Departed late as every time it does. Air conditioning initially was ineffective. However food served had the same menu item as it was served in last May when I travelled. Only advantage of flying by Air India is smooth take off and landing due to efficiency of pilots. Over all had a good flight.

column7: Flew Air India as it was the most economical. I was surprised by great seats on a New Dreamliner. Crew was friendly unlike overbearing matronly crew. It was al women crew which gave flawless service. Barely felt the touch down. in flight entertainment was far improved. meals too had better option. overall surprised.

column1: Suman M wrote a review Jun 2016
column7:
I love flying in the dreamliners.

But this time got delayed by one hour due to technical snag.

We were kept seated while there was no power in the airliner, finally after rectification of the snag the plane left one hour late.

Crew are very friendly and warm especially to old citizens. Inhouse entertainment is very good with various regional language movies. and Food is also very good. AI always known for its smooth Inflight experience and once again proved with me.

column6: In need of a dire upgrade
column7:
The orange and red interiors seemed grand back in 2000s (?) when they were introduced. IMO, the cabin needs to be redesigned. Many seats don't even recline back, and the IFE touchscreen doesn't work. Agreed, there are some passengers who are just too rude to operate them aggressively, but the airline need to maintain it. Didn't feel at all like an 'International Flight'.
The food? Bland. And cold.
Hospitality was great, though it was clouded by the above negatives.

column1: Tushar G wrote a review Jun 2016
column6: can improve a lot. though dot on time performance
column7:
The best thing about the flight was that it was on time.it started on time and landed also before time. so thats a five star. The things that can be improved
1. refurbishing of the interiors, there were some cracks in seats etc which is unpleasant
2. staff can smile a bit more and be more courteous. though they were helpful and nice but a bit of smile can add to good experience specially coming from UK where greeting and thanking is so much in culture. it felt odd when you were not greeted properly while entering
3. Food could be better.

Overall ok. but todays customers have lots of choice and will go to a airline which gives the best pleasure which unfortunately was missing in the airline.

column6: Air india has to be competitive
column7: We,three members of our family booked the tickets from Chennai to Delhi for 20th May 2016 and return flight on 29th May 2016.For both the flights the sweating arrangement was 5 A B C.During the return flight the management arbitrarily changed our seating by giving some reason or other. The food they serve is good. Previously they supplied the food from Taj Group of Hotels. Now it is from Casino and the food is ok and not comparable to Taj. Any how they have to improve a lot to be competitive.I prefer Indigo to Air India for punctuality. Indigo can also provide food.Also Thai Airways is better than Air Asia.

column6: Nice travel from Ahmedabad to Mumbai
column7: Nice travel from Ahmedabad to Mumbai in a boeing 777 first experience and enjoyed it thoroughly and also the ambiance

column7: I have traveled with AI 729 while we were going to Guwahati. The flight was OK. But it was very hot inside the airlines. The food served was not at all good. Flying hours was 1 hour only. In house services is so-so.

hi i very frequently fly with air india mostly on delhi surat route
and let me tell you that air india is improving on its schedule and on board sevices
previously they were not offering any complimentary food on this sector but from last few months they started offering good quality meals
another reason currently surat have no other airline so have to move mumbai or vadodara for other options rest airindia is here for delhi

column7: We witnessed a very rude attitude of the cabin crew towards a innocent old woman whom we think was flying for the first time. ..cabin crew was not very smart and was very rude as well.

column6: Good flight expereince,They are still in Business..
column7: After using Air India i realized that they are still in business and providing good service as well. Crew member was really helpful. I saw lot of people are unhappy with Air India. But i didn't found any reason to dislike them. I will prefer to fly with in future.

column7:
please be careful when you are travelling with your family about seat selection, even you have reserved the seats but that might be changed if you have not web checked

I had very bad experience myself with wife & two kids .., all travelled at different seats instead had reserved seats in same row ... but air line people says this was your preferred seat which has been changed in different rows

If you'll fly by "AIR INDIA" then I guess upto 99.6% you won't regret! (0.4% , well you can not make everyone happy!).

*Hospitality is really very nice, staff is very courteous.
*Fares are economical.
*Food is tasty, while booking flight you have to choose whether you want vegetarian or non-vegetarian food.

Have a safe journey :)

column7:
Flew from New Delhi to JFK (final destination RDU, NC) with four weeks old twins. I requested for two bassinet seats (and we paid for it as there were charges for kids too) for them and that was confirmed in the ticket. The airline person saw the twins while checking in, sure. However, when we got into the plane and learned that our seats were (18J and 18K) aisle seats; not the bassinet compatible ones.
We demanded the bassinets. Those compatible seats were assigned to two adults and a 10 - 12 year old boy. I told them it was impossible to travel 15 hr holding little babies on our lab and shoulder. They called people on the ground to fix it. One person came in and admonished us to travel the way the seats were assigned as we were standing. We tried to convince from humanitarian point of view. We insisted for the bassinets, of course. He said he did not care whether we had babies or not; bassinets cannot be guaranteed. He threw his powerful weapon i.e. threatening us to remove from the plane and instructed from his woki toki to remove our baggage. He could have negotiated those three passengers easily but did not bother. You decide for your journey!

column7: Flight from BKK to DEL was 5 hours late, but at least we were informed of the delay, so could plan accordingly. However, the delay caused us to cancel sightseeing in Delhi. Flight from Delhi to Heathrow was canceled, but we were never informed. Arrived at airport 3:00 AM, only to be informed we were on another flight leaving at 2:00 PM. Had called Air India to confirm flight was on time and was assured it was. Airline seems totally clueless about their flight status. INDIA stands for "I'll Never Do It Again.

During Jan 2016 we went to USA and got an opportunity to avail the services of British Airways and American Airlines. Being an Indian we are using the services of Air India frequently, but the real appreciation for our national airline i.e. Air India, developed in our hearts after we compared it with BA and AA. Among these three airlines, AA was the worst as there was zero hospitality, poor or no in-flight entertainment facilities, excessive delay, no food services even in 7 to 8 hrs flights, poor management by ground staff, faces of cabin staff gave a clear indication that we the customers are unwelcome lot, overall it was an extremely frustrating experience. BA was better as compared to AA but still no match for Air India. In our trip we were really missing Air India and by god's grace, as our Miami - London AA flight was delayed, we were shifted from BA to Air India for London - Delhi sector and we were so happy, and as always Air India surpassed our expectations in terms of punctuality, hospitality and in-flight entertainment facilities. In AA flight no one served us water whereas in Air India we were served water, drinks, snacks, meals as many times as we wanted. This time we could distinctly realize that we never appreciate our own things and madly appreciate others whereas the facts are entirely different.

column6: Its good experience on Air India
column7: I was rushed to catch the flight. Experienced faster Check-In which give relax to me on first front. Comfortable seat with best hospitality and time bounded service.

Air India mostly flies a Boeing from New Delhi to Bangalore.
The crew is always professional. The food that they serve in flight, is good too.
The in-flight entertainment system is genuinely fine.
All in all, it is quite comfortable and affordable to fly with them. :)

Their employees act like they don't care .I don't know why but they open your luggage .every time some stuffs were missing .this time even i had a gallon of water inside my bag God knows why and how .I feel very frustrated and soon boycott this airline.
It is purely government airline. too bad service, food and not maintained at all. also on time performance is too bad.

column6: They provide food unlike other airlines but have rude staff
column7: One of the airlines that provides food/snacks/beverages at same price as that of other airlines. But the staff is pretty rude. Behave as if they are doing a favor.

column1: Simon B wrote a review Jun 2016
column6: DO NOT FLY AIR INDIA! Worst Customer Service Policy Ever
column7:
On a once in a lifetime trip to India, my family and I had the misfortune to have been booked on an Air India flight from Varanasi to Mumbai. The original flight could not take off due to a technical fault and needed a new part to be delivered. We were given tickets for a flight to New Delhi where were due to land and then catch a connecting flight an hour later to Mumbai. A huge inconvenience, but with no other option we accepted it.
Then, having issued us tickets to this Delhi flight, the Air India staff decided to delay the flight to Delhi, and use the plane that was meant for Delhi to take everyone from the Mumbai flight to Mumbai. Their solution to one delayed/cancelled flight was to delay/cancel a second one. However, to make matters worse, they had given us tickets to the flight they delayed moments before they decided to delay it and send it to the very place we were originally trying to go! In a display of unbelievable incompetency, they failed to bother to tell us they had done this until we figured it out ourselves by which time they informed us they were very sorry but they couldn't let us board the flight as it was too late. (At this time, it was still in the airport and connected to the terminal building walkway but apparently someone had completed their paperwork and despite being able to cancel and invent a new flight out of nowhere, it would be impossible to change paperwork!)
Of course, this also now meant that we would be stranded for another 3-4 hours while we waited for the flight to go to Mumbai and back AND we had obviously missed the connecting flight from Delhi that they had said we should catch!
Putting to one side how completely ridiculous and incomprehensible it is to me that an organisation can display such incompetence, my real frustration has occurred since. The last flights out of Delhi would have left prior to our arrival there due to these new additional delays meaning Air India had now given us tickets for something they physically could no longer deliver, 100% down to their own fault. (it's also worth noting our original flight was around 1pm and now at something like 6 or 7pm we were still in Varanasi airport trying to resolve this.
We were promised by the Air India manager on duty that if we cancelled our flights with them and bought new flights from another airline (Spice Jet) directly to Mumbai, given they could no longer provide the service we had paid for they would refund our tickets AND refund the Spice Jet tickets.
Having returned to the UK I emailed them to request all of this along with further claims of disruption and cancelled hotel costs that we could not make. After several months of chasing, emailing and then chasing again I finally had a reply saying they would refund my tickets. Only the Air India ones though because they didn't have the authority to refund other things. That was over a month ago. I have requested details of management trying to speak to someone with the authority to discuss my claim but I get no answer (which is reflective of how Air India have treated me since the beginning). Furthermore, a month later I still haven't even received the refund that they promised to give me in writing and every email I send requesting confirmation of this is ignored. The airline staff in the airport were laughing at the situation to our faces at how "unlucky" this all was, despite being the very people who caused the whole thing. My experience of Air India is that their entire customer service team from the very top to the very bottom is beyond appalling and no-one in the company cares even the slightest amount about their customers. I would warn anyone about using this company and advise never to do it.

column1: Ikbal V wrote a review Jun 2016
column7: I traveled from Kozhikode to Delhi with my family. The flight landed in coimbatore and Mumbai in this journey. Got good service.. The crew taken special care for my 2 years old son.

The flight was on schedule and we arrived before time. The staff was courteous and helpful. The seats in the dreamliner aircraft were comfortable in the Economy section as well.
We had an overall good experience

column1: Lukeman J wrote a review Jun 2016
column7: I was late to check in by a minute, so the lady(aunty) at the counter asked me to meet the duty manager. when i went to meet him, he denied my checkin asked me how did i come to know that i could check in if he permits. When i said, the lady at the counter told me that. He took me there, where that lady readily denied that she even said something like that.

column1: Ankan Biswas wrote a review Jun 2016
column6: proud to fly airindia ,when ever i get a chance
column7:
i know its a government based airlines and hence it has many restrictions but still please try to maintain the fleet ,its very old and literally scary ...specially as monsoon is around the corners, the tremble faced while moving through the clouds is heart breaking ,
but as per the in flight meal is concerned its one of the best... air india has always been the best in this segment when it comes to food , end of the the day its our national carrier and am very proud to be a part of it every time i fly ,,still wishing the fleet turned a bit new :D god bless
First time in Air india. Good service and good food. Staff so nice always smile . Have space for my lag.
With the flight on time...the journey began on a perfect note. This airlines provides one of the best leg room and seating comfort among the airlines operating in the country.

I booked the flight from Mumbai to Indore. Flight time was in the morning. I scheduled my appointments according to this flight timings. However to my surprise, the flight was delayed by 40 mins. And since I was retuning the same day, I had a jam packed schedule. But the food served was good. Staff is okay. Overall rating 6/10
This is only one flight service which provides accommodation after flight cancel. After cancellation of ticket not deduct much charges of cancellation.

column7: I have travelled more than 2 times in Air India. The Flight experience was good and complementary meals & beverages was good.
I was travelling with my infant child. The flight attendants were quick in action at boarding and during taxi. The landing and take off was very smooth as per reputation of Air India.

I like Air India because of its food. I am a frequent flyer and keep on shuttling between Delhi and Bengaluru and always prefer to travel by Air India.
Awesome food, courteous Cabin Crew and in flight entertainment. This is what makes it different!!
Does not Provide good Service .. Always Late Just Like Passenger Trains giving way to Superfast ....

column6: Excellent flight from Srinagar to Bangalore
column7:
Traveled on a huge Boeing flight along with 6 others, we were back from a family Holiday and was made memorable by AI staff.

Had great food, flight was super clean and on time.
Enjoyed the journey.

Wouldn't recommend unless you had no other choice or are saving a Lot of money. Staff are unless, took 1.5 hours to check in. I arrived at the airport 3 hours before the flight was due to leave and raced to get to the plane before take off. Once on the plane it took almost 2 hours before they came around with drinks. Rubbish airline and rubbish airport

column7: These Air India people are providing amazing plane called dream liner which is a very modern plane ,you can adjust shades of the window panes and enjoy variety of foods here ,the hostesses are very polite ,you can also enjoy in flight video entertainment here

column7:
I have been flying with Air India for over 4 year. Since they are using the Boeing 787 on the route Frankfurt-Delhi the comfort improved significantly. Before that it was horrible (I am talking business class)

Service on board is getting better but still room for improvement.

The biggest issue was the food. While it has been ok in any previous flight on this one I got sick and had to visit the doctor back home. I actually caught a bacteria and it was pretty clear that it came from the food on my return flight. Quite dissappointing.

column1: Anup Roy wrote a review Jun 2016
column7: Poor Service at both in Ground & Inflight.Check in process,Baggage screening is very poor.In flight service was poor.It was an International flight and that is why quality service is expected in every respect.

The seats are more spacious and comfortable than other Indian airlines. Food was OK. Service was OK. Can get lucky sometimes if you get a dreamliner flight. Even if TV is there on connecting flight, they will not turn on the entertainment if it is not international flight.

#1. Indian government bought the best plane and put in the worst seats. The seats are worst than any bus or train seats in India.
#2. The moment you get to the counter of Air India, you start to feel like you are India. Passengers have to server the staff, there is no courtesy. There is no customer service. In fact the staff act ;like they are doing us a favor.
#3 by the end of the flight, pretty much passengers were self serving, getting their own soft drinks and water from the galley.

That was my last flight with Air India. People who praise AirIndia please travel in Lufthansa or British Airways and then come back and write a review.
A totally messed up ticketing counter at kolkata. No proper management. Most machineries not working. Kiosk does not operate. No courtesy from Staff.

column1: Cas Ali wrote a review Jun 2016
column6: Flights cancelled without any offer of a different flight
column7: Less than 24 hours before we were due to fly to Nepal we were informed that our flight-the only one that day was cancelled! We had to find an air India office near to where we were staying to see what they were going to do about getting us to Nepal. We ended up being put in a flight the next day leaving at around 7.30am but told to get to the airport for about 4am because the flight was actually full but we would apparently get seats if we got to the airport early. We ended up sleeping in the airport that night and flew out early the next day-minus our luggage!!
It is the best flight, I've ever experienced. I Recommed it to family people, very impressive ambience and taste, quality and quantity of food wa good.

Despite all the criticism we heard about our National Carrier, we still decided to fly Air India and I am really glad we did so. Air India holds the edge over other airlines when it comes to their baggage allowance. All other airlines permit you only 15 kgs on the domestic sector but when you fly Air India, you are permitted 25 kgs. Now that's something. Although it was a relatively short distance from Goa to Mumbai the cabin crew were kind enough to offer us snacks.
The smooth take off and landing speaks volumes of the experience the commander of our aircraft had. From now on it will only be Air India for us.

We went to ahmedabad from Mumbai on late night flight. It was a dreamliner and service was great. Even the crew was courteous and ready to help/serve water on a small flight. Nicely maintained. Would love to opt for it again

Had travelled on a Air India domestic flight late last year.

Was pleasantly surprised by the flying experience. The AI Team seem to have improved quite a lot, on the with the changing times. Boarding and In-flight experience was quite smooth. Good served was also much improved.

Overall a nice experience

Proud as I am to be an Indian, it all fails when you plan your travel with AI. They change their flight schedules at their whimps and fancies moments before travel, with least consideration to customer service and satisfaction. Imagine, when you have a domestic flight and then a connecting international flight, they change the International flight schedules after you are on board the domestic one !! The ordeal does not end here. Then they have no clue, even the duty manager at airport, regarding the rescheduled flight. Their answer is - "We have no answer at this point". This statement comes when you are 2 hrs away from your rescheduled departure time.

This is not the first time I have seen this and faced. Earlier, they rescheduled and pre-poned a flight 4 hrs before and I had no clue. I had to catch two different connecting flights to catch my International one, being thirsty and hungry for more than 12 hrs and AI din't even care for any customer service nor even someone from them had a word ! This was a year before and I thought AI is improving and would be better next time !!

Anyone planning to travel in AI, please plan to your utmost time frames...actually you would not have the scope/liberty to plan..they'll plan your trip as per them :-( :-(

Services do not come out of patriotism...AI has to deliver as per the world standards of other major airlines.

column1: Swaraj B wrote a review Jun 2016
column7: National airline has to improve a lot, particularly the seat conditions & cleanliness. This particular plane seems to be old one and not having proper & adequate comfort. The air hostesses are at the verge of their superannuation, act like 'God Mother' with mechanical/unrealistic smile. Rest are satisfactory including the food & beverages. Some north Indian food items should also be included in the menu in this sector.

column1: Sengueny U wrote a review Jun 2016
column6: Air India my first experience in the air
column7: It happens to visit Sri lanka in our office tour with families... and it was in Air India from Chennai to Sri Lanka ... the experience is awesome... it was an hour journey and we reached sri lanka quite soft nature air hostess... and the trip really is great my first visit... in air services... air india scores....

column6: Delayed Flight due to crew not reporting on time
column7:
I am a loyal passenger who loves her country and tries to support the national airline, in spite of criticisms from most others.
I flew AirIndia to JFK and back, and was fairly happy, though it cost me more than Kuwait Airways or Qatar or Oman Air.
But when I travelled last.from New Delhi to Mumbai,.It was a shocking experience.
All flight passengers checked in, but boarding was not happening...even till 15 minutes before the take-off.
when I inquired, lots of excuses were given.. and when I insisted on knowing the real reason, I was told "the crew has not arrived".
I was shocked..till 15 minutes before take-off, there was no crew.They came in at the exact time of take-off and our flight was delayed by more than 30 minutes.
The check-in was fine but my luggage (two suitcases which were in the hold ) did not arrive with me to Ahmedabad;It took four days and numerous calls before they were delivered .

column7: I have traveled on Air India for the sixth and last time. I joined the frequent flyer program and have had to call argue with them for every single mile earned. They do not record it accurately. But this last flight was it for me...the plane was old with broken arm rests and torn carpeting that was in need of cleaning. The price of the ticket was incredible, as it has been in the past, that is how they lure you in. The service was reasonable but by no means good, and the food was inedible. I have 40,000 miles and should have close to 60K. I recently flew Qatar and realized what I have been missing!

column6: my own experience with this airline has been very positive.
column7: I have travelled on may weekends over to Kolkata, they have a really wide comfortable seat, less noise inside the airplane and the food is pretty good as well during breakfast. I have seen flight attendants handing out their own food to some passengers since they dont carry a lot of non-veg meals.
Being the National carrier Air India has come a long way. The service also has improved a lot over the years.

Dharamshala to New Delhi journey by Air India

The airport though small in size offers unlimited beauty of the surrounding area. This is perhaps the most beautiful runway I have ever seen. The aircraft it self is small but once airborne, beauty of surrounding snow peaked mountains, rivers and small houses are breathtaking.

Once in lifetime experience.
economical way oftransport...customer service is goodd.........Over all air india is good to travel but not for the people who look for leisure

only good thing about this flight is that it is a direct flight and had good food otherwise the flight condition was bad with bad service and the in flight entertainment looked more than 30yrs old.and landing was bad

column6: Good, inspite of being government owned
column7: In recent times the attitude of staff has certainly changed. From nonchalance to a bit of concern. Hopefully they would change to be like private airlines. Competitive & aggressive marketing. The best advantage of travelling in air india aircraft is leg room. In no other airline would we find such comfortable leg room & I think that about makes other deficiencies like cabin crew.s rudeness & delays

I took a early morning flight from Mumbai to kolkata on 23rd may 2016. A very good breakfast was served on board. Flight was landed to kolkata 25 minutes early that was really appreciative. I will always travel by Air India Only.

column6: "Its one of very large one, value for money but needs little more management"
column7:
Its like a local train in air having more number of seats.Each row has around 9 seats. Overall its a nice flight but needs little more management to make it as a best service.
Value for money.
Airindia is the best airlines in terms of everything be it food served , ambience , hospitality. Full marks to Airlines. Airindia is pride of India
Air crafts are good. Pilots are very experienced. Take off & Landing are smooth. What I recommend is that the AI employees must take the company to great height.

column1: Chintan S wrote a review May 2016
column6: Mixed experince, but more of the horror side
column7: I was traveling with my complete family - 10 members, we were very excited to get on the dream liner (i.e. AI 308) after reaching Delhi from Ahmedabad. My horror started from Ahmedabad to Delhi, we had four air hostess, out of which two were in a very bad mood. One of the air hostess was nearly the age of my mom, and she behaved liked one, shouted on passengers and made faces. Do not ask them for food change or anything, they would literally insult you. The second part of horror started with Delhi to Melbourne. The dream liner was so beautiful and spacious, you would never find so much space between seats in any other flight. It went bad with the poor quality of services and rudeness of the serving staff. At a moment i felt like the staff was doing us a favor by working. Too much rude, never bothered to comfort passengers, on a 13 hours continuous flight. As mentioned before, never ask them anything.

Heard lot of bad publicity about air india, but It was rather nice experience. booked because of low ticket price. I worst i found about air india flight is delays, otherwise in flight experience was excellent. Average rating because of delays.

column6: Trip Back home to Mumbai with Air India
column7: Flying with Air India can be very tricky. The service and the on time performance is never consistent. I prefer Air India over other airlines only because of its new induction of Dreamliners in the fleet. Air India operates majority of its international destination with the Dreamliner. Air India is the only carrier in India having Dreamliner. So I opt Air India only if I am travelling for leisure, as timing and delay wont bother me much, both a smooth flying experience is guaranteed, which is more important to me

column6: An airline with lots of scope for development & better service.But it still rocks.
column7:
As my review is for this particular flight of mine , which is between delhi to kullu or you can say IGI airport to Bhuntar airport.In an Aerospatiale/Alenia 72 seater ATR plane. It's a special route.thank you air India only you flies between this route :)
First of all I was very lucky to be able to book an airfare sale offer ticket by Air India in thier New year or May be diwali sale.
The average ticket price on this route remains rupees 5500 but I got it for rupees1700(In sale).But as I know most of the other travelers paid more than 5000 rupess , I would review it keeping that in mind . For an air distance of just 300 miles , delhi to kullu , paying a price , for which you can actually book a delhi to dubai flight is strange .But the reason is that the bhuntar airport can't manage big planes so the 72 seater plane costs high per seat & on maintenance and running cost.
You get light breakfast including a sandwich,a muffin,tea,water bottle.
flight begins at 6:35 am reaches 7:50am.
Summary is that though its little costly,but it saves you from a 12 hour of bus journey ,plus the outside view of the himalayas is cool . so it's good if you have money spend it on this flight :) & pray more airlines start plying between this routes.
one flight daily delhi kullu , kullu delhi .
only economy seats.
good staff

I have travelled more than 8 times in Air India. The Flight experience was good and complementary meals & beverages was good. Two times flight delayed approximate one hour and another time delayed around 6 hours. Otherwise in most of my experience flight was on time. Overall a good journey.

column6: A Local Train in The Sky
column7: Air India is not like before. It may be cheaper than other airlines but it literally feels like you are flying in a train. The food is pathetic and the service is horrible. the seats are uncomfortable and during one my seat did not have a recline button it was broken and on the return back half my screen was covered with the strap from the headrest of the person in front of me.

column7: My experience after international flights Air India is best. Landing was very smooth. And all the Attendents were very helpful.

I used to fly in various airlines to various parts of the country. Last November 2015
, I travelled in Air India . Unlike other cramped airlines , often Air India has beautiful seating arrangement , seats are large and broad, spacious enough to accommodate even the heavier people and I had three in my entourage. The point is they were all happy beyond description after they reach Ahmedabad. I noticed that it's often less crowded, and luggage free allowed is 25 kgs , really astounding. Air hostesses are clad chic in yellow and red sarees greeting you with namaskar and namasthe. Our journey was two-fold . Coimbatore to Mumbai was the first part and we reached Termminal B. We didn't need to shift the luggage , it's auto transit. We have to walk at least half kilometer to check into the international terminal where we checked in to another Airline which came from New York. This was called the 'Dreamliner' the mega boeing of Air India . We were served meals and tea two times . The air trip was quiet nice and joyous. NOWADAYS AIR INDIA HAS IMPROVED A LOT WITH REGARD TO PUNCTUALITY . So it's always better to travel in the nations aircraft.
BE RELIEVED THAT THEY WAIT FOR YOU TILL THIRTY MINUTES BEFORE DEPARTURE AND YOU CAN BRING LUGGAGE UPTO 25 KILOS . IF YOU BRING THE ELDERLY DON'T WORRY , THEY HAVE MINI MOTOR TRANSPORTERS IN BIG AIRPORTS AND SPECIAL MANUAL CHAIRS IN OTHER AIRPORTS, THIS IS THE GIFT GIVEN TO US BY THE AVIATION MINISTRY

Air should inform the exact situation and at the right time what is the exact problem they should try to buy time and passengers get frustrated. Would suggest they should keep informing passengers every minute what has happen and give the right information. If you keep in touch with your customer and keep them update they shall also be positive towards it and plan things accordingly.

column6: Time to reitre a few air crew and aircraft
column7:
The aircraft is an old A320. The flight was supposed to start boarding at 1215h. However to my delight the boarding started at 1200h and I was very happy. But once entering the aircraft I realised that the APU (Auxilary Power Unit) which also keeps the airconditioning ON on ground was not working and the aircraft was very very hot and humid. The mandatory pre-flight briefing was cut short by the captain who annouced that we will be taking off immediately and asked to flight crew to take their seats! And we took off immediately.

For such a long flight (Port Blair - Visakhapatnam - New Delhi) there was no in-flight entertainment and certainly no meals. Only two pieces of sandwiches and a juice. The air hostess was also in hurry who was almost tossing the packet!

The aircraft landed early at Visakhapatnam and the passengers who boarded were also taken by surprise at the lack of airconditioning on ground. A senior air hostess upon boarding the aircraft, rudely asked a passenger who was sitting in the front row- A, to move to the window seat so that she could keep her bag. In return she also got a rude NO from the passenger! Taken by surprise, the air hostess repeated 'No? you wont move?' and the passenger re-affirmed NO!! Nice entertainment indeed.

A couple of the passengers who boarded at Visakhapatnam asked for feedback performa and started filling it up. One even asked other passengers to fill it up, which was heared by one of the senior air hostess. She reprimanded the passenger for inciting others and after that they were heated arguments. Luckily it was again interrupted by the captain who said we were taking off and lo.. we were on the air again.

After sometime we were again given two peices of sandwich and a juice. The rest of the flight was uneventful. The aircraft reached New Delhi control at 1700h, at least one hour early! I was really happy but fate had other plans. New Delhi was experiencing Thunder Showers and dust storm and the aircraft was put on a holding pattern by the Control. After a while the captain announced that the weather was bad and all (including air crew) to take seats and fasten their seat belts.

What followed was one of the worst buffeting I experienced in my 20 odd years of flying. The aircraft was literally tossed up and down and many of the passengers really freaked out. The one to be freaking out the most was was the senior air hostess! She was literally screaming prayers to different gods!! I had been thinking that it was their (air hostess) job to comfort the passengers. But this one was scaring other passengers real bad!! God knows how she has been kept in service.

Finally after more than an hour, the captain broke clouds and expertly landed the aircraft. All were safe and happy.

A few passengers who were harping on complaining on landing (about the non-functional airconditioners) were very happy to be on ground - alive again, collected their luggage and vanished into thin air.
The flight was smooth with good food served. The attendants were a bit casual. The service was up to the mark.

column6: A good airline, can be number one if it has a better management
column7: AI has the best leg room and the best in flight food. All they need to do is improve their service levels overall and be more customer friendly and make sure the in flight entertainment system works!

Air India's service has been improving over time, since the last 15-18 months & that's a surprise but a welcome step. The timeliness is improving, the staff is courteous & smiling & the food quality is good as well. Kudos

column6: great airline with excellent staff and fleet.
column7:
air india have the expertise to manage different type of airlines and they do the servicing of many airlines.their rate is competitive and they provide excellent package for customer.
ultimate maharaja of sky with nice food and rate.

Time has got no value for this carrier. On 18 may 16, the morning flight to Indore delayed by nearly one and half hour for unknown reason and not explained by anyone. Could not keep up my schedule. This is a normal phenomena in this airline in all sectors. On-time performance is by exception only. Best is to avoid it, unless one does not have any choice left.

column1: Rohit Bhonsle wrote a review May 2016
column7:
I was travelled with family from Mumbai to Bangkok. Air India AI330 is Boeing 787 Dreamliner Jet with 250 passenger capacity. In flight experience was amazing. The Dreamliner has very good in-flight entertainment, Every seat has separate led screen which is fully loaded with Marathi, Hindi, English Movies, Comedy shows, songs and many more. Most amazing thing is we can track our flight on map realtime.
On board food quality is superb. They serve best quality scotch in international flight.
Really enjoy the flying experience with Air India.
Thank you very much Star Alliance - Air India.

column6: One thing u need to be careful of!
column7:
Hi I recently traveled from Goa to Mumbai on Air India (May 2016) One advice to all travelers. If you are travelling to Mumbai and if your Air India flight says International Terminal, then one word of advice, be prepared for extra long hours for check-out. All said and done the Airline has really upgraded their flight updates compared to a few years ago, however there are many counts on which they lag drastically. In-flight dining experience really sucks, the stewards are the typical no-smiling characters that appear on the sidelines and do mostly nothing. It is this idiotic experience of landing in the International Terminal and trying to decipher your way out of the terminal and show your boarding passes a multiple times at the various check-points. I don't know where the finger actually points, at the GVK airport or at the Airlines. This is due to the fact that at the International Terminal the way out is through the duty free shop. One pointer...look for the floor signs as in a parking lot for your way out. Also, be prepared to be wowed by the scents and the sights greeting you on your way out. If you have the stomach for digesting temptation in all forms :-) For someone who wants to find the easiest way to get off the flight, find their luggage and hop into a cab (that's affordable and does not rip you) ...the whole experience was a long stretched nightmare...into 4 hours only to get out that damned building. GVK really needs to work on this customer experience.

One another tip about Air India. Ours was a late night flight which was delayed due to factors beyond the Airlines control. However, the only food served on board was a half cheese sandwich...the kids travelling on the airlines were hungry as hell and being late night all the restaurants at the airport were closed. Someone, somewhere so a little humanity please...all in all a real nightmare for me as I am a very keen observer of customer delight. This one needs a way lot of work!

Pick this only if this is the cheapest...
Pros: Free Food
Cons: Average to Poor customer service... if you can survive that, it's value for money...

It was very good experience to travel through Air India, seating was very comfortable and they also serve you free breakfast (haha) in this short route.

Other Airlines normally take charges for any kind of breakfast and coffee or tea.

column1: Tarit Ganguly wrote a review May 2016
column7: Beautiful Carrier with In-Flight entertainment and exceptionally Quality Food preparation. Simply love the way it is, As National Carrier still its Good to travel with.. You will love the carrier's Service and offerings....

Had travelled by the National carrier some time back from Mumbai.

The check in and boarding processes were quite smooth and so was the actual flight. As it was an early morning and short flight, wasnt served proper breakfast. But service was quite ok.

Best part was the nice deal we got as had booked in advance

column6: Just point A to B and nothing else................
column7:
Positives:
Hard to find on this leg of the journey but let me think hard...................hmmmm the journey ended after 12 hours in flight

Negatives:
Where do I start? Okay start with the boarding, perfectly Indian and chaotic, nobody had the patience to be in Q.
Flight departed late as the as the incoming aircraft was late and the boarding made it worse and arrived late in Delhi too (standard thing across most AI flights).
The in-flight entertainment was not working, so they changed my seat from a window to middle.
The seat had a better width and pitch but the cushioning was not comfortable and the second seat I was allocated had push-back problem.
The in-flight meal service was fast but started a bit late
On this flight they had one beer per person quota
The toilets were literally unusable (after about four hours in to the flight) as they were stinking people on this flight had no concern for their co-passengers.
Although the air-hostess/host were screaming not to do so, the passengers started getting up from their seat as soon as the flight touched down (even it had not exited the main runway) and were carelessly opening the overhead storage, actually saw a bag falling from it on to a seated passenger.\
And...........................the list just goes ON

Finally I was free from the captivity of AI 301.

The Dreamliner aircraft was very comfortable and the service was on time. Having a direct flight from MEL to DEL is wonderful.
The food was average on the MEL/DEL flight but below average on the return.
Check in was great in both directions.
The only thing that let this down was the service of the cabin crew and the lack of cleaning of the toilets and rubbish from the aircraft.

When buying my ticket, before paying, this is the information that was given about baggage:

Passenger travelling on Alliance Air to Air India or vice versa would be allowed Free Baggage Allowance of 25 Kgs per passenger per flight.
For journey applicable only on Alliance Air Flights (Aircraft types - CRJ / ATR 42) FBA would continue to be restricted to 15 Kgs.

After finding the flight I wanted, I looked everywhere and read all of the fine print. I didn't see any information about what kind of aircraft I would be on. It is very important for me to be allowed 25 kgs because I am going on to an international flight. However, AFTER I bought the ticket, I was informed that the baggage allowance was only 15 kgs.
I emailed the company and complained. They did nothing. They refuse to increase the baggage for me. This is unacceptable customer service. How can a person make an informed decision without being informed?

column1: Kaushik D wrote a review May 2016
column7:
We had always heard stories about AI and have always conveniently avoided so far, but for Male did not have a better choice. The onward and return flights were AI265 and AI266.
Being on time wasn't an expectation with AI and it never will be. Its not something they strive to achieve, and nor do they care. Both the flights were delayed severely.
Though I had booked seat numbers during booking via the AI website, and had it printed on ticket, they changed it for some illogical reason during checkin..then whats the point ?
No assistance for women with infants during boarding, they're also expected to crowrd-board as others.
The aircraft was from a previous era, seats smeared with food, a newspaper that was read 100 times and stuffed in the pockets, torn fabric, hand marks here and there etc. The seat mounted AV systems was a showpiece only.
Food was sad..very sad..rice and the veg smelled like made from old ingredients. Salad was probably a week old, dry and dead.The sweet dish (Rajbhog in AI266) was expired (being a foodie bengali I am qualified enough to differentiate between these goods and bads ). Tea/Coffee was served in metal jugs that we'd see in roadside restaurants (no they were not costly antiques)
The inflight announcements seemed to be very angry and the cabin crew did not know how to smile or make the travelers feel comfortable. Very very cold interpersonal skills.
Toilets were dirty, which wasn't a surprise.

The only saving grace was the legroom in economy and the somewhat empty aircraft, which allowed us to use the middle seat for our little one.

And Air India is supposed to our official airlines..huh!
